definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
(idiom) to rely on a single authority to determine what is correct/to regard a source (or entity or individual) as the ultimate authority

sentences.english: The convention starts September 1 in St. Paul, Minnesota.
sentences.chinese: 大会定于9月1日在明尼苏达州圣保罗市开幕。

sentences.english: In this aspect, the dissemination study present is all flowers blooms together, has not decided one.
sentences.chinese: 在这方面，传播学现在是百花齐放，没有定于一尊。

sentences.english: The boat-race has been officially fixed for Thursday, April 2.
sentences.chinese: 划船比赛已正式定于4月2日星期四举行。
来条收悉，定于明天下午两点拜访。

sentences.english: The report is scheduled for 8:30 a.m. in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 该报告定于上午8:30在华盛顿发表。

sentences.english: When is the train from Shanghai due in Ningbo?
sentences.chinese: 上海来的火车定于什么时候抵达宁波？

sentences.english: ASEAN is scheduled for March 22 to discuss the Thai-Cambodian border dispute.
sentences.chinese: 东盟定于本月22日讨论泰柬边界争端。

sentences.english: The Mid-Autumn Festival falls on the 15th day of the 8th lunar month.
sentences.chinese: 中秋节定于每年的阴历八月十五日。

sentences.english: We are due to land at Beijing at 12:50.
sentences.chinese: 我们的航班定于12点50在北京机场降落。

sentences.english: Bernanke is scheduled to testify tomorrow before the House Financial Services Committee.
sentences.chinese: 伯南克定于明天向众议院金融服务委员会作证。

sentences.english: A major government crack-down on crime is planned for next month.
sentences.chinese: 政府一项重大的镇压犯罪的行动定于下月开始。

sentences.english: Andy Lau and Yang Lijuan are set to walk into the hall of holy matrimony on July 1.
sentences.chinese: 牛和羊定于七月一号步入神圣的婚姻殿堂。

sentences.english: The case against Mr. White is said to be heard tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 据说怀特先生被起诉一案定于明天开庭。

sentences.english: The building is next to the CCTV tower, which is due to open in October.
sentences.chinese: 这座大楼邻近定于十月开放的央视大厦。

sentences.english: Mr Green leaves Beijing for home tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 格林先生定于明天离京返家。

sentences.english: The new airport is scheduled to open just before Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 新机场定于圣诞节前开始使用。

definition: to notify at a different time/to notify later/to give prior notice
to convene (a conference or meeting)/to convoke/to call together
when the time comes/at the scheduled time
to call a conference/to convene a meeting
to await a decision/to be pending
